paper_abstract: We show that any 1-round 2-server Private Information Retrieval Protocol where the answers are one bit long must ask questions that are at least n-2 bits long, which is nearly equal to the known n-1 upper bound. This improves upon the approximately 0.25n lower bound of Kerenidis and deWolf while avoiding their use of quantum techniques.
paper_title: A tight lower bound for restricted pir protocols
